p: There are two other zoonoses of medical importance in the USâ€“Mexico borderlands. Brucellosis is one of the most common zoonosis worldwide and a leading cause of disability [121]. Goat and cow dairy products are an important source of infection from Mexico [122], with 1,056 cases of brucellosis reported between 1993 and 2002 (although Mead et al. estimated that 1,554 cases occur annually [123]), of which almost 80% of the cases occur among individuals of Hispanic origin [122]. Between 1994 and 2000, 129 cases of bovine tuberculosis ( Mycobacterium bovis) were reported, nearly all among patients of Hispanic origin, particularly children [124].
